interfaces.network.message_queueÂ¶

Source: src\interfaces\network\message_queue.py

Module OverviewÂ¶

Message queue communication interfaces for distributed control systems. This module provides message queue-based communication with support for ZeroMQ, RabbitMQ, and other queue systems for scalable, reliable messaging in distributed control applications.

Complete Source CodeÂ¶

  1#======================================================================================\\\
  2#====================== src/interfaces/network/message_queue.py =======================\\\
  3#======================================================================================\\\
  4
  5"""
  6Message queue communication interfaces for distributed control systems.
  7This module provides message queue-based communication with support for
  8ZeroMQ, RabbitMQ, and other queue systems for scalable, reliable
  9messaging in distributed control applications.
 10"""
 11
 12import asyncio
 13import time
 14import json
 15import pickle
 16from typing import Optional, Dict, Any, Tuple, Callable, List
 17import logging
 18from abc import ABC, abstractmethod
 19
 20from ..core.protocols import CommunicationProtocol, MessageMetadata, ConnectionState, MessageType, Priority
 21from ..core.data_types import Message, ConnectionInfo, InterfaceConfig, InterfaceType
 22
 23try:
 24    import zmq
 25    import zmq.asyncio
 26    ZMQ_AVAILABLE = True
 27except ImportError:
 28    ZMQ_AVAILABLE = False
 29
 30try:
 31    import aio_pika
 32    RABBITMQ_AVAILABLE = True
 33except ImportError:
 34    RABBITMQ_AVAILABLE = False
 35
 36
 37class MessageQueueInterface(CommunicationProtocol, ABC):
 38    """
 39    Abstract base class for message queue interfaces.
 40
 41    Features:
 42    - Publish/subscribe messaging patterns
 43    - Request/reply patterns
 44    - Message persistence
 45    - Load balancing
 46    - Acknowledgments and reliability
 47    """
 48
 49    def __init__(self, config: InterfaceConfig):
 50        """Initialize message queue interface."""
 51        self._config = config
 52        self._connection_state = ConnectionState.DISCONNECTED
 53        self._stats = {
 54            'messages_sent': 0,
 55            'messages_received': 0,
 56            'bytes_sent': 0,
 57            'bytes_received': 0,
 58            'publish_count': 0,
 59            'subscribe_count': 0,
 60            'last_activity': 0.0
 61        }
 62        self._message_handlers: Dict[str, Callable] = {}  # topic -> handler
 63        self._logger = logging.getLogger(f"mq_interface_{config.name}")
 64
 65    @abstractmethod
 66    async def publish(self, topic: str, data: Any, metadata: Optional[MessageMetadata] = None) -> bool:
 67        """Publish message to topic."""
 68        pass
 69
 70    @abstractmethod
 71    async def subscribe(self, topic: str, handler: Callable) -> bool:
 72        """Subscribe to topic with message handler."""
 73        pass
 74
 75    @abstractmethod
 76    async def unsubscribe(self, topic: str) -> bool:
 77        """Unsubscribe from topic."""
 78        pass
 79
 80    @abstractmethod
 81    async def request(self, data: Any, timeout: Optional[float] = None) -> Optional[Any]:
 82        """Send request and wait for reply."""
 83        pass
 84
 85    @abstractmethod
 86    async def reply(self, request_data: Any, response_data: Any) -> bool:
 87        """Send reply to request."""
 88        pass
 89
 90
 91class ZeroMQInterface(MessageQueueInterface):
 92    """
 93    ZeroMQ communication interface for high-performance messaging.
 94
 95    Features:
 96    - Multiple socket patterns (PUB/SUB, REQ/REP, PUSH/PULL)
 97    - High throughput and low latency
 98    - Built-in load balancing
 99    - No broker required
100    """
101
102    def __init__(self, config: InterfaceConfig):
103        """Initialize ZeroMQ interface."""
104        if not ZMQ_AVAILABLE:
105            raise ImportError("ZeroMQ not available. Install with: pip install pyzmq")
106
107        super().__init__(config)
108        self._context: Optional[zmq.asyncio.Context] = None
109        self._sockets: Dict[str, zmq.asyncio.Socket] = {}
110        self._socket_types = {
111            'pub': zmq.PUB,
112            'sub': zmq.SUB,
113            'req': zmq.REQ,
114            'rep': zmq.REP,
115            'push': zmq.PUSH,
116            'pull': zmq.PULL,
117            'dealer': zmq.DEALER,
118            'router': zmq.ROUTER
119        }
120        self._receive_tasks: Dict[str, asyncio.Task] = {}
121
122    async def connect(self, config: Dict[str, Any]) -> bool:
123        """Establish ZeroMQ connection."""
124        try:
125            self._context = zmq.asyncio.Context()
126
127            # Create sockets based on configuration
128            socket_configs = config.get('sockets', [])
129            for socket_config in socket_configs:
130                await self._create_socket(socket_config)
131
132            self._connection_state = ConnectionState.CONNECTED
133            self._stats['last_activity'] = time.time()
134            self._logger.info("ZeroMQ interface connected")
135            return True
136
137        except Exception as e:
138            self._logger.error(f"Failed to establish ZeroMQ connection: {e}")
139            self._connection_state = ConnectionState.ERROR
140            return False
141
142    async def disconnect(self) -> bool:
143        """Close ZeroMQ connection."""
144        try:
145            self._connection_state = ConnectionState.DISCONNECTED
146
147            # Cancel receive tasks
148            for task in self._receive_tasks.values():
149                task.cancel()
150                try:
151                    await task
152                except asyncio.CancelledError:
153                    pass
154            self._receive_tasks.clear()
155
156            # Close sockets
157            for socket in self._sockets.values():
158                socket.close()
159            self._sockets.clear()
160
161            # Terminate context
162            if self._context:
163                self._context.term()
164                self._context = None
165
166            self._logger.info("ZeroMQ connection closed")
167            return True
168
169        except Exception as e:
170            self._logger.error(f"Error closing ZeroMQ connection: {e}")
171            return False
172
173    async def send(self, data: Any, metadata: Optional[MessageMetadata] = None) -> bool:
174        """Send data via ZeroMQ (using default socket)."""
175        # Use publish method for default sending
176        return await self.publish("default", data, metadata)
177
178    async def receive(self, timeout: Optional[float] = None) -> Optional[Tuple[Any, MessageMetadata]]:
179        """Receive data via ZeroMQ (from default socket)."""
180        # ZeroMQ typically uses handlers for receiving
181        # This method is provided for compatibility
182        return None
183
184    def get_connection_state(self) -> ConnectionState:
185        """Get current connection state."""
186        return self._connection_state
187
188    def get_statistics(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
189        """Get ZeroMQ communication statistics."""
190        stats = self._stats
191        stats['connection_state'] = self._connection_state.value
192        stats['active_sockets'] = len(self._sockets)
193        stats['socket_names'] = list(self._sockets.keys())
194        return stats
195
196    async def publish(self, topic: str, data: Any, metadata: Optional[MessageMetadata] = None) -> bool:
197        """Publish message to topic using PUB socket."""
198        try:
199            pub_socket = self._sockets.get('pub')
200            if not pub_socket:
201                self._logger.error("No PUB socket available for publishing")
202                return False
203
204            # Create message metadata if not provided
205            if metadata is None:
206                metadata = MessageMetadata(
207                    message_id=f"zmq_{int(time.time() * 1000000)}",
208                    timestamp=time.time(),
209                    message_type=MessageType.DATA,
210                    priority=Priority.NORMAL,
211                    source=self._config.name
212                )
213
214            # Serialize message
215            message_data = self._serialize_message(data, metadata)
216
217            # Send with topic prefix
218            await pub_socket.send_multipart([
219                topic.encode('utf-8'),
220                message_data
221            ])
222
223            # Update statistics
224            self._stats['messages_sent'] += 1
225            self._stats['publish_count'] += 1
226            self._stats['bytes_sent'] += len(message_data)
227            self._stats['last_activity'] = time.time()
228
229            return True
230
231        except Exception as e:
232            self._logger.error(f"Failed to publish ZeroMQ message: {e}")
233            return False
234
235    async def subscribe(self, topic: str, handler: Callable) -> bool:
236        """Subscribe to topic with message handler."""
237        try:
238            sub_socket = self._sockets.get('sub')
239            if not sub_socket:
240                self._logger.error("No SUB socket available for subscribing")
241                return False
242
243            # Set subscription filter
244            sub_socket.setsockopt(zmq.SUBSCRIBE, topic.encode('utf-8'))
245
246            # Register handler
247            self._message_handlers[topic] = handler
248
249            # Start receive task if not already running
250            if 'sub' not in self._receive_tasks:
251                self._receive_tasks['sub'] = asyncio.create_task(
252                    self._subscribe_receive_loop()
253                )
254
255            self._stats['subscribe_count'] += 1
256            self._logger.info(f"Subscribed to topic: {topic}")
257            return True
258
259        except Exception as e:
260            self._logger.error(f"Failed to subscribe to topic {topic}: {e}")
261            return False
262
263    async def unsubscribe(self, topic: str) -> bool:
264        """Unsubscribe from topic."""
265        try:
266            sub_socket = self._sockets.get('sub')
267            if not sub_socket:
268                return False
269
270            # Remove subscription filter
271            sub_socket.setsockopt(zmq.UNSUBSCRIBE, topic.encode('utf-8'))
272
273            # Remove handler
274            if topic in self._message_handlers:
275                del self._message_handlers[topic]
276
277            self._logger.info(f"Unsubscribed from topic: {topic}")
278            return True
279
280        except Exception as e:
281            self._logger.error(f"Failed to unsubscribe from topic {topic}: {e}")
282            return False
283
284    async def request(self, data: Any, timeout: Optional[float] = None) -> Optional[Any]:
285        """Send request and wait for reply using REQ socket."""
286        try:
287            req_socket = self._sockets.get('req')
288            if not req_socket:
289                self._logger.error("No REQ socket available for request")
290                return None
291
292            # Create metadata
293            metadata = MessageMetadata(
294                message_id=f"zmq_req_{int(time.time() * 1000000)}",
295                timestamp=time.time(),
296                message_type=MessageType.COMMAND,
297                priority=Priority.NORMAL,
298                source=self._config.name
299            )
300
301            # Serialize and send request
302            message_data = self._serialize_message(data, metadata)
303            await req_socket.send(message_data)
304
305            # Wait for reply
306            if timeout:
307                reply_data = await asyncio.wait_for(
308                    req_socket.recv(),
309                    timeout=timeout
310                )
311            else:
312                reply_data = await req_socket.recv()
313
314            # Deserialize reply
315            reply, reply_metadata = self._deserialize_message(reply_data)
316
317            # Update statistics
318            self._stats['messages_sent'] += 1
319            self._stats['messages_received'] += 1
320            self._stats['last_activity'] = time.time()
321
322            return reply
323
324        except asyncio.TimeoutError:
325            self._logger.warning("Request timeout")
326            return None
327        except Exception as e:
328            self._logger.error(f"Request failed: {e}")
329            return None
330
331    async def reply(self, request_data: Any, response_data: Any) -> bool:
332        """Send reply to request using REP socket."""
333        try:
334            rep_socket = self._sockets.get('rep')
335            if not rep_socket:
336                self._logger.error("No REP socket available for reply")
337                return False
338
339            # Create metadata
340            metadata = MessageMetadata(
341                message_id=f"zmq_rep_{int(time.time() * 1000000)}",
342                timestamp=time.time(),
343                message_type=MessageType.RESPONSE,
344                priority=Priority.NORMAL,
345                source=self._config.name
346            )
347
348            # Serialize and send reply
349            message_data = self._serialize_message(response_data, metadata)
350            await rep_socket.send(message_data)
351
352            # Update statistics
353            self._stats['messages_sent'] += 1
354            self._stats['last_activity'] = time.time()
355
356            return True
357
358        except Exception as e:
359            self._logger.error(f"Failed to send reply: {e}")
360            return False
361
362    async def _create_socket(self, socket_config: Dict[str, Any]) -> None:
363        """Create and configure ZeroMQ socket."""
364        socket_name = socket_config['name']
365        socket_type = socket_config['type']
366        endpoint = socket_config['endpoint']
367        bind = socket_config.get('bind', False)
368
369        if socket_type not in self._socket_types:
370            raise ValueError(f"Unknown socket type: {socket_type}")
371
372        # Create socket
373        socket = self._context.socket(self._socket_types[socket_type])
374
375        # Configure socket options
376        options = socket_config.get('options', {})
377        for option, value in options.items():
378            socket.setsockopt(getattr(zmq, option.upper()), value)
379
380        # Bind or connect
381        if bind:
382            socket.bind(endpoint)
383            self._logger.info(f"ZeroMQ {socket_type} socket '{socket_name}' bound to {endpoint}")
384        else:
385            socket.connect(endpoint)
386            self._logger.info(f"ZeroMQ {socket_type} socket '{socket_name}' connected to {endpoint}")
387
388        self._sockets[socket_name] = socket
389
390        # Start receive task for reply sockets
391        if socket_type == 'rep':
392            self._receive_tasks[socket_name] = asyncio.create_task(
393                self._reply_receive_loop(socket)
394            )
395
396    async def _subscribe_receive_loop(self) -> None:
397        """Receive loop for SUB socket."""
398        try:
399            sub_socket = self._sockets['sub']
400
401            while self._connection_state == ConnectionState.CONNECTED:
402                try:
403                    # Receive multipart message
404                    topic_bytes, message_data = await sub_socket.recv_multipart()
405                    topic = topic_bytes.decode('utf-8')
406
407                    # Deserialize message
408                    data, metadata = self._deserialize_message(message_data)
409
410                    # Update statistics
411                    self._stats['messages_received'] += 1
412                    self._stats['bytes_received'] += len(message_data)
413                    self._stats['last_activity'] = time.time()
414
415                    # Call handler
416                    handler = self._message_handlers.get(topic)
417                    if handler:
418                        asyncio.create_task(self._call_handler(handler, data, metadata, topic))
419
420                except Exception as e:
421                    self._logger.error(f"Error in subscribe receive loop: {e}")
422
423        except asyncio.CancelledError:
424            pass
425        except Exception as e:
426            self._logger.error(f"Subscribe receive loop error: {e}")
427
428    async def _reply_receive_loop(self, rep_socket: zmq.asyncio.Socket) -> None:
429        """Receive loop for REP socket."""
430        try:
431            while self._connection_state == ConnectionState.CONNECTED:
432                try:
433                    # Receive request
434                    message_data = await rep_socket.recv()
435
436                    # Deserialize request
437                    data, metadata = self._deserialize_message(message_data)
438
439                    # Update statistics
440                    self._stats['messages_received'] += 1
441                    self._stats['bytes_received'] += len(message_data)
442                    self._stats['last_activity'] = time.time()
443
444                    # Call handler (should send reply)
445                    handler = self._message_handlers.get('request')
446                    if handler:
447                        asyncio.create_task(self._call_handler(handler, data, metadata))
448                    else:
449                        # Send default reply if no handler
450                        await self.reply(data, {'status': 'no_handler'})
451
452                except Exception as e:
453                    self._logger.error(f"Error in reply receive loop: {e}")
454
455        except asyncio.CancelledError:
456            pass
457        except Exception as e:
458            self._logger.error(f"Reply receive loop error: {e}")
459
460    async def _call_handler(self, handler: Callable, data: Any, metadata: MessageMetadata, topic: Optional[str] = None) -> None:
461        """Call message handler safely."""
462        try:
463            if asyncio.iscoroutinefunction(handler):
464                if topic:
465                    await handler(data, metadata, topic)
466                else:
467                    await handler(data, metadata)
468            else:
469                if topic:
470                    handler(data, metadata, topic)
471                else:
472                    handler(data, metadata)
473        except Exception as e:
474            self._logger.error(f"Error in ZeroMQ message handler: {e}")
475
476    def _serialize_message(self, data: Any, metadata: MessageMetadata) -> bytes:
477        """Serialize message data and metadata."""
478        message = {
479            'metadata': {
480                'message_id': metadata.message_id,
481                'timestamp': metadata.timestamp,
482                'message_type': metadata.message_type.value,
483                'priority': metadata.priority.value,
484                'source': metadata.source,
485                'destination': metadata.destination,
486                'correlation_id': metadata.correlation_id
487            },
488            'data': data
489        }
490
491        # Use JSON for simple data, pickle for complex objects
492        try:
493            return json.dumps(message).encode('utf-8')
494        except (TypeError, ValueError):
495            return pickle.dumps(message)
496
497    def _deserialize_message(self, data: bytes) -> Tuple[Any, MessageMetadata]:
498        """Deserialize message data and metadata."""
499        try:
500            # Try JSON first
501            try:
502                message = json.loads(data.decode('utf-8'))
503            except (json.JSONDecodeError, UnicodeDecodeError):
504                # Fall back to pickle
505                message = pickle.loads(data)
506
507            # Extract metadata
508            meta_dict = message['metadata']
509            metadata = MessageMetadata(
510                message_id=meta_dict['message_id'],
511                timestamp=meta_dict['timestamp'],
512                message_type=MessageType(meta_dict['message_type']),
513                priority=Priority(meta_dict['priority']),
514                source=meta_dict['source'],
515                destination=meta_dict.get('destination'),
516                correlation_id=meta_dict.get('correlation_id')
517            )
518
519            return message['data'], metadata
520
521        except Exception as e:
522            self._logger.error(f"Failed to deserialize ZeroMQ message: {e}")
523            raise
524
525
526class RabbitMQInterface(MessageQueueInterface):
527    """
528    RabbitMQ communication interface for reliable messaging.
529
530    Features:
531    - Message persistence and durability
532    - Routing and exchanges
533    - Acknowledgments and reliability
534    - Dead letter queues
535    """
536
537    def __init__(self, config: InterfaceConfig):
538        """Initialize RabbitMQ interface."""
539        if not RABBITMQ_AVAILABLE:
540            raise ImportError("RabbitMQ client not available. Install with: pip install aio-pika")
541
542        super().__init__(config)
543        self._connection: Optional[aio_pika.Connection] = None
544        self._channel: Optional[aio_pika.Channel] = None
545        self._queues: Dict[str, aio_pika.Queue] = {}
546        self._exchanges: Dict[str, aio_pika.Exchange] = {}
547
548    async def connect(self, config: Dict[str, Any]) -> bool:
549        """Establish RabbitMQ connection."""
550        try:
551            url = config.get('url', 'amqp://guest:guest@localhost/')
552            self._connection = await aio_pika.connect_robust(url)
553            self._channel = await self._connection.channel()
554
555            self._connection_state = ConnectionState.CONNECTED
556            self._stats['last_activity'] = time.time()
557            self._logger.info("RabbitMQ interface connected")
558            return True
559
560        except Exception as e:
561            self._logger.error(f"Failed to establish RabbitMQ connection: {e}")
562            self._connection_state = ConnectionState.ERROR
563            return False
564
565    async def disconnect(self) -> bool:
566        """Close RabbitMQ connection."""
567        try:
568            self._connection_state = ConnectionState.DISCONNECTED
569
570            if self._connection:
571                await self._connection.close()
572                self._connection = None
573                self._channel = None
574
575            self._queues.clear()
576            self._exchanges.clear()
577
578            self._logger.info("RabbitMQ connection closed")
579            return True
580
581        except Exception as e:
582            self._logger.error(f"Error closing RabbitMQ connection: {e}")
583            return False
584
585    async def send(self, data: Any, metadata: Optional[MessageMetadata] = None) -> bool:
586        """Send data via RabbitMQ (using default exchange)."""
587        return await self.publish("", data, metadata)
588
589    async def receive(self, timeout: Optional[float] = None) -> Optional[Tuple[Any, MessageMetadata]]:
590        """Receive data via RabbitMQ."""
591        # RabbitMQ typically uses handlers for receiving
592        return None
593
594    def get_connection_state(self) -> ConnectionState:
595        """Get current connection state."""
596        return self._connection_state
597
598    def get_statistics(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
599        """Get RabbitMQ communication statistics."""
600        stats = self._stats
601        stats['connection_state'] = self._connection_state.value
602        stats['active_queues'] = len(self._queues)
603        stats['active_exchanges'] = len(self._exchanges)
604        return stats
605
606    async def publish(self, routing_key: str, data: Any, metadata: Optional[MessageMetadata] = None, exchange: str = "") -> bool:
607        """Publish message to RabbitMQ exchange."""
608        try:
609            if not self._channel:
610                return False
611
612            # Create message metadata if not provided
613            if metadata is None:
614                metadata = MessageMetadata(
615                    message_id=f"rmq_{int(time.time() * 1000000)}",
616                    timestamp=time.time(),
617                    message_type=MessageType.DATA,
618                    priority=Priority.NORMAL,
619                    source=self._config.name
620                )
621
622            # Serialize message
623            message_data = self._serialize_message(data, metadata)
624
625            # Create message
626            message = aio_pika.Message(
627                message_data,
628                message_id=metadata.message_id,
629                timestamp=metadata.timestamp,
630                headers={
631                    'source': metadata.source,
632                    'message_type': metadata.message_type.value,
633                    'priority': metadata.priority.value
634                }
635            )
636
637            # Get exchange
638            if exchange and exchange in self._exchanges:
639                exchange_obj = self._exchanges[exchange]
640            else:
641                exchange_obj = self._channel.default_exchange
642
643            # Publish message
644            await exchange_obj.publish(message, routing_key=routing_key)
645
646            # Update statistics
647            self._stats['messages_sent'] += 1
648            self._stats['publish_count'] += 1
649            self._stats['bytes_sent'] += len(message_data)
650            self._stats['last_activity'] = time.time()
651
652            return True
653
654        except Exception as e:
655            self._logger.error(f"Failed to publish RabbitMQ message: {e}")
656            return False
657
658    async def subscribe(self, queue_name: str, handler: Callable) -> bool:
659        """Subscribe to RabbitMQ queue with message handler."""
660        try:
661            if not self._channel:
662                return False
663
664            # Declare queue
665            queue = await self._channel.declare_queue(queue_name, durable=True)
666            self._queues[queue_name] = queue
667
668            # Register handler
669            self._message_handlers[queue_name] = handler
670
671            # Start consuming
672            await queue.consume(
673                lambda message: asyncio.create_task(
674                    self._handle_rabbitmq_message(message, handler)
675                )
676            )
677
678            self._stats['subscribe_count'] += 1
679            self._logger.info(f"Subscribed to RabbitMQ queue: {queue_name}")
680            return True
681
682        except Exception as e:
683            self._logger.error(f"Failed to subscribe to queue {queue_name}: {e}")
684            return False
685
686    async def unsubscribe(self, queue_name: str) -> bool:
687        """Unsubscribe from RabbitMQ queue."""
688        try:
689            if queue_name in self._queues:
690                queue = self._queues[queue_name]
691                await queue.cancel()
692                del self._queues[queue_name]
693
694            if queue_name in self._message_handlers:
695                del self._message_handlers[queue_name]
696
697            self._logger.info(f"Unsubscribed from RabbitMQ queue: {queue_name}")
698            return True
699
700        except Exception as e:
701            self._logger.error(f"Failed to unsubscribe from queue {queue_name}: {e}")
702            return False
703
704    async def request(self, data: Any, timeout: Optional[float] = None) -> Optional[Any]:
705        """Send request and wait for reply using RabbitMQ RPC pattern."""
706        # Implementation would require setting up temporary reply queue
707        # and correlation IDs for RPC pattern
708        self._logger.warning("RabbitMQ request/reply not yet implemented")
709        return None
710
711    async def reply(self, request_data: Any, response_data: Any) -> bool:
712        """Send reply to request using RabbitMQ."""
713        # Implementation would require extracting reply_to and correlation_id
714        # from request message and sending to reply queue
715        self._logger.warning("RabbitMQ request/reply not yet implemented")
716        return False
717
718    async def _handle_rabbitmq_message(self, message: aio_pika.IncomingMessage, handler: Callable) -> None:
719        """Handle incoming RabbitMQ message."""
720        try:
721            async with message.process():
722                # Deserialize message
723                data, metadata = self._deserialize_message(message.body)
724
725                # Update statistics
726                self._stats['messages_received'] += 1
727                self._stats['bytes_received'] += len(message.body)
728                self._stats['last_activity'] = time.time()
729
730                # Call handler
731                await self._call_handler(handler, data, metadata)
732
733        except Exception as e:
734            self._logger.error(f"Error handling RabbitMQ message: {e}")
735
736    async def _call_handler(self, handler: Callable, data: Any, metadata: MessageMetadata) -> None:
737        """Call message handler safely."""
738        try:
739            if asyncio.iscoroutinefunction(handler):
740                await handler(data, metadata)
741            else:
742                handler(data, metadata)
743        except Exception as e:
744            self._logger.error(f"Error in RabbitMQ message handler: {e}")
745
746    def _serialize_message(self, data: Any, metadata: MessageMetadata) -> bytes:
747        """Serialize message data and metadata."""
748        message = {
749            'metadata': {
750                'message_id': metadata.message_id,
751                'timestamp': metadata.timestamp,
752                'message_type': metadata.message_type.value,
753                'priority': metadata.priority.value,
754                'source': metadata.source,
755                'destination': metadata.destination,
756                'correlation_id': metadata.correlation_id
757            },
758            'data': data
759        }
760
761        return json.dumps(message).encode('utf-8')
762
763    def _deserialize_message(self, data: bytes) -> Tuple[Any, MessageMetadata]:
764        """Deserialize message data and metadata."""
765        try:
766            message = json.loads(data.decode('utf-8'))
767
768            # Extract metadata
769            meta_dict = message['metadata']
770            metadata = MessageMetadata(
771                message_id=meta_dict['message_id'],
772                timestamp=meta_dict['timestamp'],
773                message_type=MessageType(meta_dict['message_type']),
774                priority=Priority(meta_dict['priority']),
775                source=meta_dict['source'],
776                destination=meta_dict.get('destination'),
777                correlation_id=meta_dict.get('correlation_id')
778            )
779
780            return message['data'], metadata
781
782        except Exception as e:
783            self._logger.error(f"Failed to deserialize RabbitMQ message: {e}")
784            raise

ClassesÂ¶

MessageQueueInterfaceÂ¶

Inherits from: CommunicationProtocol, ABC

Abstract base class for message queue interfaces.

Features:

  • Publish/subscribe messaging patterns

  • Request/reply patterns

  • Message persistence

  • Load balancing

  • Acknowledgments and reliability

Source CodeÂ¶

 1class MessageQueueInterface(CommunicationProtocol, ABC):
 2    """
 3    Abstract base class for message queue interfaces.
 4
 5    Features:
 6    - Publish/subscribe messaging patterns
 7    - Request/reply patterns
 8    - Message persistence
 9    - Load balancing
10    - Acknowledgments and reliability
11    """
12
13    def __init__(self, config: InterfaceConfig):
14        """Initialize message queue interface."""
15        self._config = config
16        self._connection_state = ConnectionState.DISCONNECTED
17        self._stats = {
18            'messages_sent': 0,
19            'messages_received': 0,
20            'bytes_sent': 0,
21            'bytes_received': 0,
22            'publish_count': 0,
23            'subscribe_count': 0,
24            'last_activity': 0.0
25        }
26        self._message_handlers: Dict[str, Callable] = {}  # topic -> handler
27        self._logger = logging.getLogger(f"mq_interface_{config.name}")
28
29    @abstractmethod
30    async def publish(self, topic: str, data: Any, metadata: Optional[MessageMetadata] = None) -> bool:
31        """Publish message to topic."""
32        pass
33
34    @abstractmethod
35    async def subscribe(self, topic: str, handler: Callable) -> bool:
36        """Subscribe to topic with message handler."""
37        pass
38
39    @abstractmethod
40    async def unsubscribe(self, topic: str) -> bool:
41        """Unsubscribe from topic."""
42        pass
43
44    @abstractmethod
45    async def request(self, data: Any, timeout: Optional[float] = None) -> Optional[Any]:
46        """Send request and wait for reply."""
47        pass
48
49    @abstractmethod
50    async def reply(self, request_data: Any, response_data: Any) -> bool:
51        """Send reply to request."""
52        pass

ZeroMQInterfaceÂ¶

Inherits from: MessageQueueInterface

ZeroMQ communication interface for high-performance messaging.

Features:

  • Multiple socket patterns (PUB/SUB, REQ/REP, PUSH/PULL)

  • High throughput and low latency

  • Built-in load balancing

  • No broker required

Source CodeÂ¶

  1class ZeroMQInterface(MessageQueueInterface):
  2    """
  3    ZeroMQ communication interface for high-performance messaging.
  4
  5    Features:
  6    - Multiple socket patterns (PUB/SUB, REQ/REP, PUSH/PULL)
  7    - High throughput and low latency
  8    - Built-in load balancing
  9    - No broker required
 10    """
 11
 12    def __init__(self, config: InterfaceConfig):
 13        """Initialize ZeroMQ interface."""
 14        if not ZMQ_AVAILABLE:
 15            raise ImportError("ZeroMQ not available. Install with: pip install pyzmq")
 16
 17        super().__init__(config)
 18        self._context: Optional[zmq.asyncio.Context] = None
 19        self._sockets: Dict[str, zmq.asyncio.Socket] = {}
 20        self._socket_types = {
 21            'pub': zmq.PUB,
 22            'sub': zmq.SUB,
 23            'req': zmq.REQ,
 24            'rep': zmq.REP,
 25            'push': zmq.PUSH,
 26            'pull': zmq.PULL,
 27            'dealer': zmq.DEALER,
 28            'router': zmq.ROUTER
 29        }
 30        self._receive_tasks: Dict[str, asyncio.Task] = {}
 31
 32    async def connect(self, config: Dict[str, Any]) -> bool:
 33        """Establish ZeroMQ connection."""
 34        try:
 35            self._context = zmq.asyncio.Context()
 36
 37            # Create sockets based on configuration
 38            socket_configs = config.get('sockets', [])
 39            for socket_config in socket_configs:
 40                await self._create_socket(socket_config)
 41
 42            self._connection_state = ConnectionState.CONNECTED
 43            self._stats['last_activity'] = time.time()
 44            self._logger.info("ZeroMQ interface connected")
 45            return True
 46
 47        except Exception as e:
 48            self._logger.error(f"Failed to establish ZeroMQ connection: {e}")
 49            self._connection_state = ConnectionState.ERROR
 50            return False
 51
 52    async def disconnect(self) -> bool:
 53        """Close ZeroMQ connection."""
 54        try:
 55            self._connection_state = ConnectionState.DISCONNECTED
 56
 57            # Cancel receive tasks
 58            for task in self._receive_tasks.values():
 59                task.cancel()
 60                try:
 61                    await task
 62                except asyncio.CancelledError:
 63                    pass
 64            self._receive_tasks.clear()
 65
 66            # Close sockets
 67            for socket in self._sockets.values():
 68                socket.close()
 69            self._sockets.clear()
 70
 71            # Terminate context
 72            if self._context:
 73                self._context.term()
 74                self._context = None
 75
 76            self._logger.info("ZeroMQ connection closed")
 77            return True
 78
 79        except Exception as e:
 80            self._logger.error(f"Error closing ZeroMQ connection: {e}")
 81            return False
 82
 83    async def send(self, data: Any, metadata: Optional[MessageMetadata] = None) -> bool:
 84        """Send data via ZeroMQ (using default socket)."""
 85        # Use publish method for default sending
 86        return await self.publish("default", data, metadata)
 87
 88    async def receive(self, timeout: Optional[float] = None) -> Optional[Tuple[Any, MessageMetadata]]:
 89        """Receive data via ZeroMQ (from default socket)."""
 90        # ZeroMQ typically uses handlers for receiving
 91        # This method is provided for compatibility
 92        return None
 93
 94    def get_connection_state(self) -> ConnectionState:
 95        """Get current connection state."""
 96        return self._connection_state
 97
 98    def get_statistics(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 99        """Get ZeroMQ communication statistics."""
100        stats = self._stats
101        stats['connection_state'] = self._connection_state.value
102        stats['active_sockets'] = len(self._sockets)
103        stats['socket_names'] = list(self._sockets.keys())
104        return stats
105
106    async def publish(self, topic: str, data: Any, metadata: Optional[MessageMetadata] = None) -> bool:
107        """Publish message to topic using PUB socket."""
108        try:
109            pub_socket = self._sockets.get('pub')
110            if not pub_socket:
111                self._logger.error("No PUB socket available for publishing")
112                return False
113
114            # Create message metadata if not provided
115            if metadata is None:
116                metadata = MessageMetadata(
117                    message_id=f"zmq_{int(time.time() * 1000000)}",
118                    timestamp=time.time(),
119                    message_type=MessageType.DATA,
120                    priority=Priority.NORMAL,
121                    source=self._config.name
122                )
123
124            # Serialize message
125            message_data = self._serialize_message(data, metadata)
126
127            # Send with topic prefix
128            await pub_socket.send_multipart([
129                topic.encode('utf-8'),
130                message_data
131            ])
132
133            # Update statistics
134            self._stats['messages_sent'] += 1
135            self._stats['publish_count'] += 1
136            self._stats['bytes_sent'] += len(message_data)
137            self._stats['last_activity'] = time.time()
138
139            return True
140
141        except Exception as e:
142            self._logger.error(f"Failed to publish ZeroMQ message: {e}")
143            return False
144
145    async def subscribe(self, topic: str, handler: Callable) -> bool:
146        """Subscribe to topic with message handler."""
147        try:
148            sub_socket = self._sockets.get('sub')
149            if not sub_socket:
150                self._logger.error("No SUB socket available for subscribing")
151                return False
152
153            # Set subscription filter
154            sub_socket.setsockopt(zmq.SUBSCRIBE, topic.encode('utf-8'))
155
156            # Register handler
157            self._message_handlers[topic] = handler
158
159            # Start receive task if not already running
160            if 'sub' not in self._receive_tasks:
161                self._receive_tasks['sub'] = asyncio.create_task(
162                    self._subscribe_receive_loop()
163                )
164
165            self._stats['subscribe_count'] += 1
166            self._logger.info(f"Subscribed to topic: {topic}")
167            return True
168
169        except Exception as e:
170            self._logger.error(f"Failed to subscribe to topic {topic}: {e}")
171            return False
172
173    async def unsubscribe(self, topic: str) -> bool:
174        """Unsubscribe from topic."""
175        try:
176            sub_socket = self._sockets.get('sub')
177            if not sub_socket:
178                return False
179
180            # Remove subscription filter
181            sub_socket.setsockopt(zmq.UNSUBSCRIBE, topic.encode('utf-8'))
182
183            # Remove handler
184            if topic in self._message_handlers:
185                del self._message_handlers[topic]
186
187            self._logger.info(f"Unsubscribed from topic: {topic}")
188            return True
189
190        except Exception as e:
191            self._logger.error(f"Failed to unsubscribe from topic {topic}: {e}")
192            return False
193
194    async def request(self, data: Any, timeout: Optional[float] = None) -> Optional[Any]:
195        """Send request and wait for reply using REQ socket."""
196        try:
197            req_socket = self._sockets.get('req')
198            if not req_socket:
199                self._logger.error("No REQ socket available for request")
200                return None
201
202            # Create metadata
203            metadata = MessageMetadata(
204                message_id=f"zmq_req_{int(time.time() * 1000000)}",
205                timestamp=time.time(),
206                message_type=MessageType.COMMAND,
207                priority=Priority.NORMAL,
208                source=self._config.name
209            )
210
211            # Serialize and send request
212            message_data = self._serialize_message(data, metadata)
213            await req_socket.send(message_data)
214
215            # Wait for reply
216            if timeout:
217                reply_data = await asyncio.wait_for(
218                    req_socket.recv(),
219                    timeout=timeout
220                )
221            else:
222                reply_data = await req_socket.recv()
223
224            # Deserialize reply
225            reply, reply_metadata = self._deserialize_message(reply_data)
226
227            # Update statistics
228            self._stats['messages_sent'] += 1
229            self._stats['messages_received'] += 1
230            self._stats['last_activity'] = time.time()
231
232            return reply
233
234        except asyncio.TimeoutError:
235            self._logger.warning("Request timeout")
236            return None
237        except Exception as e:
238            self._logger.error(f"Request failed: {e}")
239            return None
240
241    async def reply(self, request_data: Any, response_data: Any) -> bool:
242        """Send reply to request using REP socket."""
243        try:
244            rep_socket = self._sockets.get('rep')
245            if not rep_socket:
246                self._logger.error("No REP socket available for reply")
247                return False
248
249            # Create metadata
250            metadata = MessageMetadata(
251                message_id=f"zmq_rep_{int(time.time() * 1000000)}",
252                timestamp=time.time(),
253                message_type=MessageType.RESPONSE,
254                priority=Priority.NORMAL,
255                source=self._config.name
256            )
257
258            # Serialize and send reply
259            message_data = self._serialize_message(response_data, metadata)
260            await rep_socket.send(message_data)
261
262            # Update statistics
263            self._stats['messages_sent'] += 1
264            self._stats['last_activity'] = time.time()
265
266            return True
267
268        except Exception as e:
269            self._logger.error(f"Failed to send reply: {e}")
270            return False
271
272    async def _create_socket(self, socket_config: Dict[str, Any]) -> None:
273        """Create and configure ZeroMQ socket."""
274        socket_name = socket_config['name']
275        socket_type = socket_config['type']
276        endpoint = socket_config['endpoint']
277        bind = socket_config.get('bind', False)
278
279        if socket_type not in self._socket_types:
280            raise ValueError(f"Unknown socket type: {socket_type}")
281
282        # Create socket
283        socket = self._context.socket(self._socket_types[socket_type])
284
285        # Configure socket options
286        options = socket_config.get('options', {})
287        for option, value in options.items():
288            socket.setsockopt(getattr(zmq, option.upper()), value)
289
290        # Bind or connect
291        if bind:
292            socket.bind(endpoint)
293            self._logger.info(f"ZeroMQ {socket_type} socket '{socket_name}' bound to {endpoint}")
294        else:
295            socket.connect(endpoint)
296            self._logger.info(f"ZeroMQ {socket_type} socket '{socket_name}' connected to {endpoint}")
297
298        self._sockets[socket_name] = socket
299
300        # Start receive task for reply sockets
301        if socket_type == 'rep':
302            self._receive_tasks[socket_name] = asyncio.create_task(
303                self._reply_receive_loop(socket)
304            )
305
306    async def _subscribe_receive_loop(self) -> None:
307        """Receive loop for SUB socket."""
308        try:
309            sub_socket = self._sockets['sub']
310
311            while self._connection_state == ConnectionState.CONNECTED:
312                try:
313                    # Receive multipart message
314                    topic_bytes, message_data = await sub_socket.recv_multipart()
315                    topic = topic_bytes.decode('utf-8')
316
317                    # Deserialize message
318                    data, metadata = self._deserialize_message(message_data)
319
320                    # Update statistics
321                    self._stats['messages_received'] += 1
322                    self._stats['bytes_received'] += len(message_data)
323                    self._stats['last_activity'] = time.time()
324
325                    # Call handler
326                    handler = self._message_handlers.get(topic)
327                    if handler:
328                        asyncio.create_task(self._call_handler(handler, data, metadata, topic))
329
330                except Exception as e:
331                    self._logger.error(f"Error in subscribe receive loop: {e}")
332
333        except asyncio.CancelledError:
334            pass
335        except Exception as e:
336            self._logger.error(f"Subscribe receive loop error: {e}")
337
338    async def _reply_receive_loop(self, rep_socket: zmq.asyncio.Socket) -> None:
339        """Receive loop for REP socket."""
340        try:
341            while self._connection_state == ConnectionState.CONNECTED:
342                try:
343                    # Receive request
344                    message_data = await rep_socket.recv()
345
346                    # Deserialize request
347                    data, metadata = self._deserialize_message(message_data)
348
349                    # Update statistics
350                    self._stats['messages_received'] += 1
351                    self._stats['bytes_received'] += len(message_data)
352                    self._stats['last_activity'] = time.time()
353
354                    # Call handler (should send reply)
355                    handler = self._message_handlers.get('request')
356                    if handler:
357                        asyncio.create_task(self._call_handler(handler, data, metadata))
358                    else:
359                        # Send default reply if no handler
360                        await self.reply(data, {'status': 'no_handler'})
361
362                except Exception as e:
363                    self._logger.error(f"Error in reply receive loop: {e}")
364
365        except asyncio.CancelledError:
366            pass
367        except Exception as e:
368            self._logger.error(f"Reply receive loop error: {e}")
369
370    async def _call_handler(self, handler: Callable, data: Any, metadata: MessageMetadata, topic: Optional[str] = None) -> None:
371        """Call message handler safely."""
372        try:
373            if asyncio.iscoroutinefunction(handler):
374                if topic:
375                    await handler(data, metadata, topic)
376                else:
377                    await handler(data, metadata)
378            else:
379                if topic:
380                    handler(data, metadata, topic)
381                else:
382                    handler(data, metadata)
383        except Exception as e:
384            self._logger.error(f"Error in ZeroMQ message handler: {e}")
385
386    def _serialize_message(self, data: Any, metadata: MessageMetadata) -> bytes:
387        """Serialize message data and metadata."""
388        message = {
389            'metadata': {
390                'message_id': metadata.message_id,
391                'timestamp': metadata.timestamp,
392                'message_type': metadata.message_type.value,
393                'priority': metadata.priority.value,
394                'source': metadata.source,
395                'destination': metadata.destination,
396                'correlation_id': metadata.correlation_id
397            },
398            'data': data
399        }
400
401        # Use JSON for simple data, pickle for complex objects
402        try:
403            return json.dumps(message).encode('utf-8')
404        except (TypeError, ValueError):
405            return pickle.dumps(message)
406
407    def _deserialize_message(self, data: bytes) -> Tuple[Any, MessageMetadata]:
408        """Deserialize message data and metadata."""
409        try:
410            # Try JSON first
411            try:
412                message = json.loads(data.decode('utf-8'))
413            except (json.JSONDecodeError, UnicodeDecodeError):
414                # Fall back to pickle
415                message = pickle.loads(data)
416
417            # Extract metadata
418            meta_dict = message['metadata']
419            metadata = MessageMetadata(
420                message_id=meta_dict['message_id'],
421                timestamp=meta_dict['timestamp'],
422                message_type=MessageType(meta_dict['message_type']),
423                priority=Priority(meta_dict['priority']),
424                source=meta_dict['source'],
425                destination=meta_dict.get('destination'),
426                correlation_id=meta_dict.get('correlation_id')
427            )
428
429            return message['data'], metadata
430
431        except Exception as e:
432            self._logger.error(f"Failed to deserialize ZeroMQ message: {e}")
433            raise

RabbitMQInterfaceÂ¶

Inherits from: MessageQueueInterface

RabbitMQ communication interface for reliable messaging.

Features:

  • Message persistence and durability

  • Routing and exchanges

  • Acknowledgments and reliability

  • Dead letter queues

Source CodeÂ¶

  1class RabbitMQInterface(MessageQueueInterface):
  2    """
  3    RabbitMQ communication interface for reliable messaging.
  4
  5    Features:
  6    - Message persistence and durability
  7    - Routing and exchanges
  8    - Acknowledgments and reliability
  9    - Dead letter queues
 10    """
 11
 12    def __init__(self, config: InterfaceConfig):
 13        """Initialize RabbitMQ interface."""
 14        if not RABBITMQ_AVAILABLE:
 15            raise ImportError("RabbitMQ client not available. Install with: pip install aio-pika")
 16
 17        super().__init__(config)
 18        self._connection: Optional[aio_pika.Connection] = None
 19        self._channel: Optional[aio_pika.Channel] = None
 20        self._queues: Dict[str, aio_pika.Queue] = {}
 21        self._exchanges: Dict[str, aio_pika.Exchange] = {}
 22
 23    async def connect(self, config: Dict[str, Any]) -> bool:
 24        """Establish RabbitMQ connection."""
 25        try:
 26            url = config.get('url', 'amqp://guest:guest@localhost/')
 27            self._connection = await aio_pika.connect_robust(url)
 28            self._channel = await self._connection.channel()
 29
 30            self._connection_state = ConnectionState.CONNECTED
 31            self._stats['last_activity'] = time.time()
 32            self._logger.info("RabbitMQ interface connected")
 33            return True
 34
 35        except Exception as e:
 36            self._logger.error(f"Failed to establish RabbitMQ connection: {e}")
 37            self._connection_state = ConnectionState.ERROR
 38            return False
 39
 40    async def disconnect(self) -> bool:
 41        """Close RabbitMQ connection."""
 42        try:
 43            self._connection_state = ConnectionState.DISCONNECTED
 44
 45            if self._connection:
 46                await self._connection.close()
 47                self._connection = None
 48                self._channel = None
 49
 50            self._queues.clear()
 51            self._exchanges.clear()
 52
 53            self._logger.info("RabbitMQ connection closed")
 54            return True
 55
 56        except Exception as e:
 57            self._logger.error(f"Error closing RabbitMQ connection: {e}")
 58            return False
 59
 60    async def send(self, data: Any, metadata: Optional[MessageMetadata] = None) -> bool:
 61        """Send data via RabbitMQ (using default exchange)."""
 62        return await self.publish("", data, metadata)
 63
 64    async def receive(self, timeout: Optional[float] = None) -> Optional[Tuple[Any, MessageMetadata]]:
 65        """Receive data via RabbitMQ."""
 66        # RabbitMQ typically uses handlers for receiving
 67        return None
 68
 69    def get_connection_state(self) -> ConnectionState:
 70        """Get current connection state."""
 71        return self._connection_state
 72
 73    def get_statistics(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 74        """Get RabbitMQ communication statistics."""
 75        stats = self._stats
 76        stats['connection_state'] = self._connection_state.value
 77        stats['active_queues'] = len(self._queues)
 78        stats['active_exchanges'] = len(self._exchanges)
 79        return stats
 80
 81    async def publish(self, routing_key: str, data: Any, metadata: Optional[MessageMetadata] = None, exchange: str = "") -> bool:
 82        """Publish message to RabbitMQ exchange."""
 83        try:
 84            if not self._channel:
 85                return False
 86
 87            # Create message metadata if not provided
 88            if metadata is None:
 89                metadata = MessageMetadata(
 90                    message_id=f"rmq_{int(time.time() * 1000000)}",
 91                    timestamp=time.time(),
 92                    message_type=MessageType.DATA,
 93                    priority=Priority.NORMAL,
 94                    source=self._config.name
 95                )
 96
 97            # Serialize message
 98            message_data = self._serialize_message(data, metadata)
 99
100            # Create message
101            message = aio_pika.Message(
102                message_data,
103                message_id=metadata.message_id,
104                timestamp=metadata.timestamp,
105                headers={
106                    'source': metadata.source,
107                    'message_type': metadata.message_type.value,
108                    'priority': metadata.priority.value
109                }
110            )
111
112            # Get exchange
113            if exchange and exchange in self._exchanges:
114                exchange_obj = self._exchanges[exchange]
115            else:
116                exchange_obj = self._channel.default_exchange
117
118            # Publish message
119            await exchange_obj.publish(message, routing_key=routing_key)
120
121            # Update statistics
122            self._stats['messages_sent'] += 1
123            self._stats['publish_count'] += 1
124            self._stats['bytes_sent'] += len(message_data)
125            self._stats['last_activity'] = time.time()
126
127            return True
128
129        except Exception as e:
130            self._logger.error(f"Failed to publish RabbitMQ message: {e}")
131            return False
132
133    async def subscribe(self, queue_name: str, handler: Callable) -> bool:
134        """Subscribe to RabbitMQ queue with message handler."""
135        try:
136            if not self._channel:
137                return False
138
139            # Declare queue
140            queue = await self._channel.declare_queue(queue_name, durable=True)
141            self._queues[queue_name] = queue
142
143            # Register handler
144            self._message_handlers[queue_name] = handler
145
146            # Start consuming
147            await queue.consume(
148                lambda message: asyncio.create_task(
149                    self._handle_rabbitmq_message(message, handler)
150                )
151            )
152
153            self._stats['subscribe_count'] += 1
154            self._logger.info(f"Subscribed to RabbitMQ queue: {queue_name}")
155            return True
156
157        except Exception as e:
158            self._logger.error(f"Failed to subscribe to queue {queue_name}: {e}")
159            return False
160
161    async def unsubscribe(self, queue_name: str) -> bool:
162        """Unsubscribe from RabbitMQ queue."""
163        try:
164            if queue_name in self._queues:
165                queue = self._queues[queue_name]
166                await queue.cancel()
167                del self._queues[queue_name]
168
169            if queue_name in self._message_handlers:
170                del self._message_handlers[queue_name]
171
172            self._logger.info(f"Unsubscribed from RabbitMQ queue: {queue_name}")
173            return True
174
175        except Exception as e:
176            self._logger.error(f"Failed to unsubscribe from queue {queue_name}: {e}")
177            return False
178
179    async def request(self, data: Any, timeout: Optional[float] = None) -> Optional[Any]:
180        """Send request and wait for reply using RabbitMQ RPC pattern."""
181        # Implementation would require setting up temporary reply queue
182        # and correlation IDs for RPC pattern
183        self._logger.warning("RabbitMQ request/reply not yet implemented")
184        return None
185
186    async def reply(self, request_data: Any, response_data: Any) -> bool:
187        """Send reply to request using RabbitMQ."""
188        # Implementation would require extracting reply_to and correlation_id
189        # from request message and sending to reply queue
190        self._logger.warning("RabbitMQ request/reply not yet implemented")
191        return False
192
193    async def _handle_rabbitmq_message(self, message: aio_pika.IncomingMessage, handler: Callable) -> None:
194        """Handle incoming RabbitMQ message."""
195        try:
196            async with message.process():
197                # Deserialize message
198                data, metadata = self._deserialize_message(message.body)
199
200                # Update statistics
201                self._stats['messages_received'] += 1
202                self._stats['bytes_received'] += len(message.body)
203                self._stats['last_activity'] = time.time()
204
205                # Call handler
206                await self._call_handler(handler, data, metadata)
207
208        except Exception as e:
209            self._logger.error(f"Error handling RabbitMQ message: {e}")
210
211    async def _call_handler(self, handler: Callable, data: Any, metadata: MessageMetadata) -> None:
212        """Call message handler safely."""
213        try:
214            if asyncio.iscoroutinefunction(handler):
215                await handler(data, metadata)
216            else:
217                handler(data, metadata)
218        except Exception as e:
219            self._logger.error(f"Error in RabbitMQ message handler: {e}")
220
221    def _serialize_message(self, data: Any, metadata: MessageMetadata) -> bytes:
222        """Serialize message data and metadata."""
223        message = {
224            'metadata': {
225                'message_id': metadata.message_id,
226                'timestamp': metadata.timestamp,
227                'message_type': metadata.message_type.value,
228                'priority': metadata.priority.value,
229                'source': metadata.source,
230                'destination': metadata.destination,
231                'correlation_id': metadata.correlation_id
232            },
233            'data': data
234        }
235
236        return json.dumps(message).encode('utf-8')
237
238    def _deserialize_message(self, data: bytes) -> Tuple[Any, MessageMetadata]:
239        """Deserialize message data and metadata."""
240        try:
241            message = json.loads(data.decode('utf-8'))
242
243            # Extract metadata
244            meta_dict = message['metadata']
245            metadata = MessageMetadata(
246                message_id=meta_dict['message_id'],
247                timestamp=meta_dict['timestamp'],
248                message_type=MessageType(meta_dict['message_type']),
249                priority=Priority(meta_dict['priority']),
250                source=meta_dict['source'],
251                destination=meta_dict.get('destination'),
252                correlation_id=meta_dict.get('correlation_id')
253            )
254
255            return message['data'], metadata
256
257        except Exception as e:
258            self._logger.error(f"Failed to deserialize RabbitMQ message: {e}")
259            raise
